verses.verse: For the Chief Musician; set to Al-tashheth. A Psalm of David. Michtam; when he fled from Saul, in the cave. Be merciful <WH2603> unto me <WH430>, O God, be merciful <WH2603> unto me <WH5315>; For my soul taketh refuge <WH2620> in thee <WH6738>: Yea, in the shadow of thy wings <WH3671> will I take refuge <WH2620>, Until these calamities <WH1942> be overpast <WH5674>.
I will cry <WH7121> unto God <WH430> Most High <WH5945>, Unto God <WH410> that performeth all things for me <WH1584>.

He will send <WH7971> from heaven <WH8064>, and save <WH3467> me <WH7602>, When he that would swallow me up reproacheth <WH2778>; <WH5542>[[Selah God <WH430> will send forth <WH7971> his lovingkindness <WH2617> and his truth <WH571>.

My soul <WH5315> is among <WH8432> lions <WH3833>; I lie <WH7901> among them that are set on fire <WH3857>, Even the sons <WH1121> of men <WH120>, whose teeth <WH8127> are spears <WH2595> and arrows <WH2671>, And their tongue <WH3956> a sharp <WH2299> sword <WH2719>.
Be thou exalted <WH7311>, O God <WH430>, above the heavens <WH8064>; Let thy glory <WH3519> be above all the earth <WH776>.

They have prepared <WH3559> a net <WH7568> for my steps <WH6471>; My soul <WH5315> is bowed down <WH3721>: They have digged <WH3738> a pit <WH7882> before <WH6440> me <WH5307>; They are fallen into the midst <WH8432> thereof themselves <WH5542>. [[Selah
My heart <WH3820> is fixed <WH3559>, O God <WH430>, my heart <WH3820> is fixed <WH3559>: I will sing <WH7891>, yea <WH2167>, I will sing praises.
Awake up <WH5782>, my glory <WH3519>; Awake <WH5782>, psaltery <WH5035> and harp <WH3658>: I myself will awake <WH5782> right early <WH7837>.
I will give thanks <WH3034> unto thee <WH136>, O Lord, among the peoples <WH5971>: I will sing <WH2167> praises unto thee among the nations <WH3816>.
For thy lovingkindness <WH2617> is great <WH1419> unto the heavens <WH8064>, And thy truth <WH571> unto the skies <WH7834>.
Be thou exalted <WH7311>, O God <WH430>, above the heavens <WH8064>; Let thy glory <WH3519> be above all the earth <WH776>.
